meanings.definition: A large, round fruit with green skin and red flesh.
meanings.sent1: During summer picnics, we always enjoy slicing into juicy watermelons.
meanings.sent2: The grocery store had a sale on watermelons, so I bought a big one.
meanings.sent3: At the watermelon eating contest, Tom accidentally dropped his slice on his lap.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright and refreshing as a slice of watermelon on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the crunch as I bit into the watermelon was music to my ears.

meanings.definition: The sweet, juicy flesh of a watermelon.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside, the kids cooled off with slices of watermelons.
meanings.sent2: The best part of a watermelon is the sweet, juicy watermelon flesh.
meanings.sent3: The watermelon juice dripped down his chin, making him look like a messy eater.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as sweet and refreshing as the taste of watermelon on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The watermelon flesh was so ripe and succulent, it practically melted in my mouth.

meanings.definition: A plant of the gourd family, bearing watermelons.
meanings.sent1: The watermelons in our garden are growing bigger each day.
meanings.sent2: The farmer planted watermelons in rows to maximize space.
meanings.sent3: The watermelon plant seemed to wave in the breeze, as if saying hello.
meanings.sent4: The vines of the watermelon plant twisted and turned like a maze in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the watermelon plant in bloom filled the air with a sweet fragrance.
